Coursework

This repository collects all resoures and material that I am using towards learning Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

None of this material is mine. I have collected them from various sources on Github and elsewhere. Many thanks to josephmisiti, jhermann, kirang89, ujjwalkarn, s16h, datasciencemasters, and hangtwenty. Much of my thinking and plans have been shaped by their awesome lists of resources.

The Basics and the General

  • Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects completed
  • Introduction to Computer Science and Programming using Python completed
  • Python for Data Science
  • Probability - The Science and Uncertainty of Data
  • Algorithm Design and Techniques
  • Introduction to Computational Thinking and Data Science
  • Probability and Statistics in Data Science using Python
  • Effective Thinking Through Mathematics

Machine Learning

  • Machine learning crash course - Google Devs, Highly recommended
  • Introduction to machine learning for coders - fast.ai
  • Introduction to Machine Learning with scikit-learn
  • Machine Learning - Andrew Ng
  • cs229 - Machine Learning - The Stanford class by Andrew Ng which is a step up from the Coursera course
  • Some basic machine learning project ideas
  • Some toy problem ideas
  • Google’s seedbank - Collection of colaboratory notebooks to play and explore machine learning code. Select all posts under the Basic ML and internalize.

Textbooks to follow along

  • Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow - Aurelien Geron
  • Python Data Analysis - Wes McKinney
  • Python Machine Learning: Machine Learning and Deep Learning with Python, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow, 2nd Edition
  • Elements of Statistical Learning
  • A course in Machine Learning - Hal Daume
  • Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective - Kevin Murphy

Some miscellaneous resources

  • Caltech’s Machine Learning Class - Prof Abu-Mostafa
  • Prof. Girolami’s Machine Learning Course - A more mathematical approach. Revisit after finishing all above courses to touch up any gaps in mathematics, statistics, and algorithmic knowledge.
  • Bayesian Methods for Hackers
  • Grokking Deep Learning - Trask

Deep Learning

  • Neural Networks for Machine Learning - Geoff Hinton’s course
  • cs231n - Convolution Neural Networks for Visual Recognition - Highly recommended
  • CS224d: Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing
  • Deep Learning for Coders - fast.ai - Highly recommended.
  • Artificial Intelligence - Columbia University
  • Deep Learning - Andrew Ng
  • Probabilistic programming and Bayesian methods
  • Deep learning - Udacity : Google’s class on Deep Learning

Textbooks to follow along

  • Deep Learning with Python - Francois Chollet
  • Deep Learning - Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville, Francis Bach
  • Python Machine Learning: Machine Learning and Deep Learning with Python, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow, 2nd Edition

Hands on Resources for learning-by-doing:

  • Go to hangtwenty’s list for some great ipython notebooks to jump into machine learning.
  • A visual introduction to machine learning
  • Web scraping Indeed.com for key data science skills - Try and understand this notebook completely.
  • Getting started with Keras - Google
  • Improve your python chops with this guide

Other textbooks

  • Understanding Machine Learning: From Theory to Algorithms
  • Deep learning with Python - Francois Chollet at Google who invented Keras, a simplified deep learning library for Python
  • Bayesian Reinforcement Learning - A Survey, arXiv:1609.04436

Miscellaneous Resources

Public datasets

  • Awesome public datasets
  • Basic/simple corpora
  • Public datasets from Google
  • CIFAR10 dataset

Shortlisted Datasets

  • Wikipedia page on ML datasets
  • IMDB movie reviews Large Datasets
  • Sentiment140 - Dataset with labeled polarity of 1.6M tweets
  • Million songs database - Music genre classification
  • UCI Music Analysis dataset
  • Labeled credit card transaction for fraud detection
  • Labeled edible, poisonous mushrooms
  • Gun violence datasets, The github repo to the dataset
  • Music features dataset. Also see the Kaggle dataset.
  • Yelp Dataset
  • NASA Expolanet survey
  • Great collection of datasets on AWS - See Subtitle meta-data, Medicare drug spending
  • FBI hate crimes report data
  • Uber pickup data from Jan to June 2015. Also see Green and Yellow Cab data
  • US domestic flight data from 1990 to 2009
  • UCI machine learning repository
  • USGS Earthquake data - Limit to 20,000 rows. About 5 to 6 months of earthquakes.
  • Wikipedia analytics - See especially Pageviews and pagecount
  • Pharma QSAR competition
  • Heart rate time-series - Explore at some point, seems interesting.
  • NSF grant awards abstracts 190-2003
  • UCI Air quality dataset
  • UCI Breast cancer database

Python library resources

numpy

  • From python to numpy
  • matplotlib tutorial
  • 100 numpy exercises
  • numpy tutorial - Nick Rougier
  • 101 numpy exercises - Good resource for basic numpy tasks
  • numpy tutorial

pandas

  • pandas in 10 mins - Very basic, read first
  • Things in pandas I wish I’d known earlier - Very good
  • Real world data clean-up using python and pandas - Slightly more advanced but read, internalize and understand.
  • Great set of youtube videos on standard pandas tasks and some tricks
  • Basic pandas tasks from the documentation - Read early on
  • Basic plotting with pandas and matplotlib
  • Prettier plotting using the plotly library
  • Statistics and computation using pandas
  • Useful pandas snippets - Excellent cheat sheet involving common pandas tasks
  • Intermediate to advanced pandas techniques - Read and understand all
  • Understanding and working with groupby - From the pandas docs
  • 101 pandas exercises

Podcasts

  • Talking machines - Begin with the starting simple episode.
  • Data Skeptic
  • Linear digressions
  • Partially derivative
  • The AI podast

  • A Beginners Guide to Understanding Convolutional Neural Networks - Part2

Addendum: Collection of other resources

Papers to read

  • Introduction to Convolution Neural Networks - Jianxin Wu
  • 9 Deep learning Papers you need to know about
  • LeCun, Y., Bengio, Y. and Hinton, G., 2015. Deep learning. nature, 521(7553), p.436.

  • Jordan, M.I. and Mitchell, T.M., 2015. Machine learning: Trends, perspectives, and prospects. Science, 349(6245), pp.255-260.

  • A more manageable list of highly cited Deep Learning papers
  • Huge list of paper in this github repo
